content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```
This will define a `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct that will concatenate the `value` and `unit` fields with a space between them. The `$(fwu.value)` syntax is used to interpolate the value of the `value` field into the string, while `$(fwu.unit)` does the same for the `unit` field.
